sen.j: 牧の方（まきのかた、生没年不詳）は、平安時代末期、鎌倉時代初期の女性。
sen.e: Maki no kata (Lady Maki, dates of birth and death unknown) was active from the end of the Heian to the early Kamakura periods.
Maki no kata (Lady Maki, dates of birth and death unknown) was active from the end of the Heian to the early Kamakura periods.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Maki no kata (Lady Maki, year of birth and death unknown) lived around the end of the Heian Period to the early Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の初代執権・北条時政の継室。
sen.e: She was the second wife of Tokimasa HOJO, the first shikken (shogunal regent) of the Kamakura Shogunate.
She was the second wife of Tokimasa HOJO, the first shikken (shogunal regent) of the Kamakura Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: She was the second wife of Tokimasa HOJO, the first shikken (shogunal regent) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 「the Kamakura Shogunate」→「the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)」としました。

sen.j: 牧宗親の娘とも、妹とも言われ、下級ながらも貴族の出身であった。
sen.e: She was regarded as a daughter or a sister of Munechika MAKI, coming from the nobles though the rank was low.
She was regarded as a daughter or a sister of Munechika MAKI, coming from the nobles though the rank was low.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: She was said to have been a daughter or a younger sister of Munechika MAKI, coming from the nobles although the rank was low.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。though →although

sen.j: 子は北条政範、平賀朝雅室、三条実宣室、宇都宮頼綱室。
sen.e: Masanori HOJO, Tomomasa HIRAGA's wife, Sanenobu SANJO's wife, and Yoritsuna UTSUNOMIYA's wife were her children.
Masanori HOJO, Tomomasa HIRAGA's wife, Sanenobu SANJO's wife, and Yoritsuna UTSUNOMIYA's wife were her children.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Here children included Masanori HOJO, Tomomasa HIRAGA's wife, Sanenobu SANJO's wife, and Yoritsuna UTSUNOMIYA's wife.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。補足しました。

sen.j: 夫・時政とはかなり年齢が離れていたが、その仲は睦まじかったと言われている。
sen.e: She and her husband, Tokimasa, were widely seperated in age, but they were known for being an affectionate couple.
She and her husband, Tokimasa, were widely seperated in age, but they were known for being an affectionate couple.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: She and her husband, Tokimasa, were widely separated in age, but they are said to have been an affectionate couple.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 寿永2年（1182年）11月、産後の継娘北条政子に夫源頼朝の浮気を伝えた。
sen.e: In November 1182, she informed Masako HOJO, her stepdaughter after childbirth, that MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, Masako's husband, had an affair.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In November 1182, she informed Masako HOJO, her stepdaughter after childbirth, that MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, Masako's husband, had an affair.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In December 1182, she informed Masako HOJO, her stepdaughter after childbirth, that MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, Masako's husband, had an affair.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。グレゴリオ暦に直し、余分な語をのぞきました。

sen.j: 政子が牧の方の父宗親に命じて頼朝の愛妾亀の前の屋敷を打ち壊させる騒動を引き起こしている。
sen.e: She caused such a trouble that Masako ordered Munechika, Maki no kata's father, to break down the residence of Kame no mae, Yoritomo's beloved concubine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She caused such trouble that Masako ordered Munechika, Maki no kata's father, to break down the residence of Kame no mae, Yoritomo's beloved concubine.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: She caused such trouble that Masako ordered Munechika, Maki no kata's father, to destroy the residence of Kame no mae, Yoritomo's beloved concubine.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: 元久2年（1205年）6月、時政による畠山重忠の乱が起こる。
sen.e: In June 1205, Tokimasa raised the Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In June 1205, Tokimasa raised the Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In June 1205, Tokimasa instigated the Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: これは娘婿に当たる平賀朝雅が重保のことを牧の方に讒言し、それを聞いた牧の方が時政に讒訴したためであると言われている。
sen.e: This was probably caused by the fact that Tomomasa HIRAGA, Maki no kata's son-in-law, made an ungrounded accusation of Shigeyasu, and she brought his accusation she had heard of to Tokimasa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This was probably caused by the fact that Tomomasa HIRAGA, Maki no kata's son-in-law, made an ungrounded accusation of Shigeyasu, and she brought this accusation she had heard of to Tokimasa.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: This was probably caused by the fact that Tomomasa HIRAGA, Maki no kata's son-in-law, made an ungrounded accusation against Shigeyasu, and she brought this accusation she had heard to Tokimasa.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。

sen.j: さらに同年7月、彼女は時政と共謀して源実朝を殺害した。
sen.e: In July the same year, she conspired with Tokimasa and killed MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In July of the same year, she conspired with Tokimasa and killed MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: In July of the same year, she conspired with Tokimasa and killed MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: さらに娘婿の朝雅を新将軍として擁することで幕政の実権を掌握しようと計画した。
sen.e: She also attempted to seize power in the shogunate government by way of making her son-in-law, Tomomasa, the new Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She also attempted to seize power in the shogunate government by way of making her son-in-law, Tomomasa, the new Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: She also attempted to seize power in the shogunate government by way of making her son-in-law, Tomomasa, the new Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、この計画を知った北条政子・北条義時姉弟による反撃を受けた。
sen.e: To counter her plot, Masako HOJO and her brother, Yoshitoki HOJO, started to fight back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: To counter her plot, Masako HOJO and her brother, Yoshitoki HOJO, started to fight back.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: To counter her plot, Masako HOJO and her younger brother, Yoshitoki HOJO, started to fight back.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.j: 7月20日 (旧暦)に時政と共に出家し、その後、義時の手によって伊豆国に幽閉された（牧氏事件）。
sen.e: On August 13, she and Tokimasa were forced to become priests and confined to the Izu Province by order of Yoshitoki (the Makishi Incident).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 旧暦を新暦に計算しましたので、左記のようになりました
sen.e: On August 13, she and Tokimasa were forced to become priests and confined to Izu Province by order of Yoshitoki (the Makishi Incident).
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: On August 13, she and Tokimasa were forced to become priests and confined to Izu Province by order of Yoshitoki (the Makishi Incident).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その後京都に戻って贅沢に暮らし、一族を引き連れて諸寺に詣でて藤原定家の批判を受けている。
sen.e: After that, she went back to Kyoto to live a luxurious life; she visited several temples accompanied by her family and followers, which drew criticism from FUJIWARA no Teika.
After that, she went back to Kyoto to live a luxurious life; she visited several temples accompanied by her family and followers, which drew criticism from FUJIWARA no Teika.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After that, she went back to Kyoto to live a luxurious life; she visited several temples accompanied by her family and followers, which drew criticism from FUJIWARA no Teika.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 没年は詳しく分かっていないが、嘉禄3年（1227年）に夫・時政の13回忌を行なっているため、少なくともこの前後までは生きていたと思われる。
sen.e: The date of her death was unknown; however, she carried out the thirteenth anniversary of her husband, Tokimasa's death in 1227, so at least she was probably alive until around that time.
The date of her death is unknown; however, she carried out the thirteenth anniversary of her husband, Tokimasa's death in 1227, so at she was alive until around that time.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: The year of her death is unknown; however, she carried out the 13th anniversary of her husband, Tokimasa's death in 1227, so at she was alive at least until around that time.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。表現を変えました。

sen.j: また、杉橋隆夫は牧の方の父あるいは兄とされる牧宗親と池禅尼の兄弟とされる藤原宗親（『尊卑分脈』）は同一人物であるとする説を提示している。
sen.e: Takao SUGIHASHI advanced a theory that Munechika MAKI, who was supposed to be Maki no kata's father or brother, was the same person as FUJIWARA no Munechika, a brother of Ike no zenni ("Sonpi Bunmyaku [the biographies of the nobles and humbles]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Takao SUGIHASHI advanced a theory that Munechika MAKI, who was supposed to be Maki no kata's father or brother, was the same person as FUJIWARA no Munechika, a brother of Ike no zenni ("Sonpi Bunmyaku [the biographies of the nobles and humbles]).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Takao SUGIHASHI advanced a theory that Munechika MAKI, who was supposed to be Maki no kata's father or older brother, was the same person as FUJIWARA no Munechika, a brother of Ike no zenni ("Sonpi Bunmyaku" (Bloodlines of Noble and Base)).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。文字化けを直しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 池禅尼は、平忠盛の継室で平治の乱の際に頼朝の助命を嘆願した。
sen.e: Ike no zenni, the second wife of TAIRA no Tadamori, begged for Yoritomo's life in the Heiji War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ike no zenni, the second wife of TAIRA no Tadamori, begged for Yoritomo's life in the Heiji War.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Ike no zenni, the second wife of TAIRA no Tadamori, begged for Yoritomo's life in the Heiji War.
